intro: Nenga selebica, commonly known as the Southern Cross fern, is a species of fern native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The fronds are also used as a decorative element in horticulture due to their unique appearance.
